1452212121.content:
Original Author: infinity421

THUNK

What the... What was that?

You jolt upright in bed as several unpleasant scenarios enter your head. Reaching for your baseball bat under your bed, you grab your flashlight from under the bed as well and switch it on, before walking out onto the landing.

Hopefully it wasn't robbers.

Slowly walking down the stairs as quietly as possible, you decide on what to do. If there really was a robber in your living room you could flick the light switch to see if it the noise hadn't just been from a waking dream or something, and maybe throw the torch at them to disorient them.

Breathing in quietly, you reach the living room. Deciding to place the torch on the floor, you hit the light switch and brandish your bat as you see-

-... A very, very tall woman, with...

Wings?

You unconsciously step backwards as the towering angel turns towards you, allowing you to get a good look at her. First off, there was the fact that her head was touching the ceiling. That was rather... Intimidating.

Two large, feathery wings protruded from her back, the white appendages seeming to emerge from somewhere on her shoulder blades. Warm blue eyes looked your way, complementing her golden coloured hair. A pair of... Impressively, large breasts sat on her chest, contained within what seemed to be a white robe of some sort that covered her body.

Before you can even think of what to do, the angel has opened her mouth to speak...
1452212121.title: Unintentional Intrusion

14522121211.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

"Oh! I-I'm terribly sorry for the intrusion, human! M-my name is Marie... P-please...please don't hurt me..."

Here you were, bat at the ready towards this towering winged woman...and she was absolutely terrified of you wanting to hurt her? She easily has two feet on you, she could simply snap your wrist with little trouble...and yet she was scared of you? You cautiously put the bat down. You're uncertain if it was wise to do so, but you couldn't stand the sight of her cowering any longer. It tugged at your heartstrings...even though she was an intruder. An intruder from Heaven, in more ways than one.

You sigh and respond, "I'm not going to hurt you, Marie. But I'm not 'Human'. ...Well, I am a human, but it's not my name."

Marie stops cowering, her wings spreading back out before folding against her back in a more relaxed position as she stands up. She looked at you with curiosity, before asking in her sugary sweet voice of almost pure innocence, "Then...what is it? What is your name?"

You give your name to her. "I'm Jake. But...what are you doing in my house? Aren't you supposed to be...well, up there? Am I dead, or about to die?"

To your surprise, she smiles, and then laughs at your worry. It was like hearing the happiest child's laughter, yet still feminine. "It's nice to meet you, Jake. I'm sorry about laughing about such a dire matter, but if you were dead or about to die, you would not be seeing me. You would see Death himself. Human depictions of him are...surprisingly not far off. Sadly you may see him in time, but I believe not for some time to come yet.

"Again, I am terribly sorry for the intrusion. And while I would like to return to Heaven, its gates are closed to me, and...I...I can't remember why!" Tears began to well up in her eyes as she began to cry. A part of you found her crying cute, but it was too sad to let continue. Probably part of being an angel and all that. "There, there..." You felt compelled to comfort the tall, winged woman, "So are all angels as tall as you? How long have you been here on Earth?"

Feeling better as the subject of what she was doing here was moved away from, (she was certain she hadn't done anything wrong, else she would be joining Lucifer in that place she didn't like to think of) she more calmly answers your queries. "Um...no, actually. I'm not even certain why I am so tall...Although I must admit I quite enjoy it, I was always one of the smaller angels...except in my chest, which I again must admit a degree of pride. I believe I have been wandering Earth for nearly...two years now. Yes, I am certain it has been that long. Yet, you are the first person I've encountered during this time..."

Two years...she must feel very lonely, especially if you were the first person she's ever made contact with here. Despite her intimidating stature...you found yourself...becoming attached to her. Women of such innocence were rare in the world, and she did claim you were her first contact with humanity in nearly two years... A part of you argued that you were going to regret this, yet you paid it no heed as you decided to...
14522121211.title: She introduces herself.

choices: She's just starting to grow now.
145221212111.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

Allow her to stay. She really seemed just too nice to kick her out even if your gut was still screaming to tell her to get the H-E-double hockey sticks out. Maybe it was because your luck with women lately was less than spectacular, and this one practically falls into your arms, almost too conveniently so. Still, the side wanting to let her stay won out. Who knows? Maybe if you help her out, you figure, she may put in a good word for you with the big guy up stairs. It's hard not to believe in Him when something like this happens...

"Well...I guess...you can stay. For now." You finally tell her, and in response the large angel happily runs over to you and picks you up in a tight, yet surprisingly gentle hug...that squishes you against her large breasts. Her wings rise somewhat, but not enough to bump against the ceiling like her head was doing. "Really? Oh, thank you, Jake! You're the nicest human I've ever met!"

Hold on... "I thought you said I was the first human you've met? Was that a lie?" She smiles as she puts you back down and shakes her head. "No no, that was very much the truth. You're the first and nicest human I've ever met!" Her voice makes you almost feel terrible for distrusting her, even though she doesn't seem upset in the slightest. However, sleep begins to creep back up on you, as it was still the middle of the night. You proceed to your kitchen with the curious angel in tow, who thankfully remembered to duck through the door frames along the way. You pour yourself a glass of milk and nuke it in the microwave for a few seconds to warm it up. Curiosity getting the better of her, Marie asks, "What are you doing? Is the milk too cold?" To which you answer sincerely, "I need to get back to sleep. I don't know if you angels ever sleep, but it's pretty vital for us humans. I tend to sleep easier with a glass of warm milk." You take the glass from the microwave and drink the warmed beverage, then headed back to bed and into sleep's waiting embrace once more.

In the morning, you wake up, thinking it was all a strange dream. Angels coming here of all places, how ridiculous! Yet, after getting dressed and heading into the kitchen to cook yourself some eggs for breakfast, your eye catches Marie sitting in the living room, wings in a relaxed position wrapping gently around the seat, reading one of your books. One of the '___ for Dummies' series you had lying around. You very nearly burned your eggs at the confirmation that your dream really wasn't. Hearing the commotion in the kitchen as you barely caught yourself from saying a rather inappropriately crude word at the moment your eggs were nearly burned, Marie looked up and smiled pleasantly. "Oh! Good morning, Jake! I trust you slept peacefully after my unfortunate intrusion, and your subsequent welcoming me into your home?"

You nod and offer her breakfast, which she politely declines. At least you offered. Although at this angle, you could almost swear she seemed even taller than last night. "Say, Marie? Did you grow while I was asleep? You seem taller somehow..."
145221212111.title: Let her stay.

choices: She grows a foot taller with no warning!
She suddenly grows a lot bigger than that!
1452212121111.content:
Original Author: infinity421

Marie nods. "I have grown taller, Jake, by what I believe to be roughly four inches."

Marie places the book to one side and stands up out of the chair, rising to her full height. She indicates her legs, which you could see were bent slightly through the robe. Well then, not only did you know an angel who easily dwarfed just about every person who had ever lived, but she had grown an entire four inches taller overnight!

Marie giggles softly and sits back down onto the seat, which creaks slightly from her weight. From what you had seen so far, as well as her progress with the book, it seems like she doesn't need to eat, sleep or drink. You briefly wonder if all Angels are like that before sitting down in your armchair and eating your nearly-burnt breakfast.

... Okay, you had to ask about her growth. Was it a one off thing, or would it happen again? And if so, how much would she grow?

You open your mouth and are about to ask Marie about why she grew when...
1452212121111.title: She has. By about 4 inches.

choices: She's always been able to do this.
14522121211112.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

A look suddenly crosses Marie's face when you were about to ask, one of surprise. Joy...and panic. She starts to inch up ever closer to the ceiling, all the while still sitting. Marie puts the book down and runs to you, picking you up in her increasingly bigger arms, then forces you and herself through the large window leading outside to your backyard using her head and wings as a shield against the glass shards. Considering the window was reinforced glass, Marie was clearly much stronger than her slender albeit growing frame suggested.

"Ah! I-I'm terribly sorry, Jake! I just felt myself starting to grow again, stronger this time, and I didn't wish you any harm..." she says sincerely, and regardless of your feelings to her driving you through your window...you had subconsciously already forgiven the growing angel. It might have been because of who she is, or it could be because that she had conveniently chosen the window that was already on its way out and the window repair guys were coming in the afternoon to replace it. As she finishes growing at roughly 16'8", you look up into her gorgeous sapphire eyes, beautifully framed with her golden locks and feathery white wings serving as the background. After a few minutes of staring up at the beauty you would have sworn was God if she didn't insist to merely be an angel and not the 'big guy' himself, you finally say, "...You can put me down now, Marie. My legs work fine."

Marie nods and carefully sets you down from her cradling hold on you as gently as a mother would set down her baby. And indeed, as you took in her full glory, you didn't seem to be much more than a toddler or small child to her by comparison. You like tall women...but this was admittedly a bit on the ridiculous side seeing a woman, albeit an angel, becoming larger in real life. A pinch to yourself confirms this is all very real. Stepping through the broken window to retrieve the book Marie was reading, you come back out to confront her on her growth. You needed to know if this would happen again, since she didn't seem in control of it. If she had, you figured you and she would still be inside.

"Marie? We need to talk." you say, and the angel kindly looks towards and down to you, flexing her wings in relaxation after the slightly awkward seating position all night. "Yes? What is it, Jake?" she asks again in her sugary sweet and cottony soft voice, which you query, "About your growth. I don't mind that you're growing. Really, I don't. In fact...I confess growing women is a fantasy of mine, a guilty pleasure if you will..." Marie chuckles softly. "You say it like it's a sin or something that would condemn you to...Lucifer's abode. Don't worry! It isn't! But I'm interrupting, aren't I? Please, go on." Well that was one potential worry off your chest. You continued, "Why are you growing? And will this happen again? Do you know the answer to either?"

Marie contemplates your questions, a somewhat endearing look crossing her face as she did. Finally, she concludes, "If it's happened twice now, and possibly three times if I count when I first arrived on Earth and discovered the gates of Heaven being closed to me, I would have to say that it will continue to happen again and again. I may stop at roughly one mile tall, which is both rather exciting and rather frightening for me at the same time, but I can't say if I will continue to grow beyond that or not.

"As for why...I...am really at a loss. Sorry." Marie finishes sadly, a tad upset with herself for not being able to provide a definite answer. You again comfort her by saying, "That's alright, Marie. At least we know something about all of this." The angel nods happily, and then comments, "If I knew what was causing this growth, I could try to avoid it...or speed this up to get it over with if there is no avoiding it." Either seem reasonable to you, although if she were to become a mile tall or more surely casualties and damages would begin to mount. Then again, perhaps she could choose what and what not to have her body interact with. Able to give a person a gentle poke that would send them onto their back, yet also allow herself to walk through a building without affecting it in the least. You hope for her to be able to do this.

Much to your surprise, Marie puts her hand through your bedroom wall and pulls out the suit you had placed on your bed in preparation to wear it before you made breakfast - leaving the wall completely intact as she does. Accepting the suit from her, you put it on and begin to wonder...was she always capable of this, or was it because you hoped for her to have this ability?
14522121211112.title: In the arms of an angel...literally.

145221212111121.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

You ponder about this as the morning progresses. You never considered yourself much of a believer in God. Sure, you went to church every week and all, but you felt it was more a force of habit than any actual belief in the big guy. Your parents had always made you go with them to church when you were young until it was practically routine even now. You had hoped for a girlfriend...two years ago, in fact. You had left to return home from your business trip that morning just as some fantasy convention was about to start up. And just now, Marie had demonstrated being able to choose what her body interacted with, retrieving your suit through your bedroom wall without damaging said wall. You have a hunch, but you need to know.

"Say, Marie? If you could retrieve my suit through my bedroom wall without your hand going through it...why didn't you do that when we were getting out of my house?" you asked curiously. Marie shrugged her shoulders in response after about a minute and replied, "I don't know. I was in a bit of a panic then, but...it just came into my head to try and retrieve the rest of your suit from your room while leaving the wall itself alone. It's the first time I ever did that, too. I've tried before with attempting to keep sand and dust off of me, as well as trying to keep tree branches from snagging my wings and occasionally my robe, with no success. I wonder why I was successful this time?"

Could still be a coincidence, but if it wasn't... You question with, "Where did you first land on Earth, and what was happening at the time?" The angel looks at you, confused as to what this had to do with anything, but answers honestly, "Um...I think it was Tokyo, Japan? I think the people there were complementing me on what they believed to be my costume, as almost everyone else was in one. I guess some sort of convention was going on? I just tried to keep my wings relaxed and still to keep up the disguise in plain sight. It wasn't like they believed me when I told them I was a real angel..."

That definitely couldn't be a coincidence. But if that was true... "Marie...I...I think I know why you're here, and why you can't go back yet... I'm so sorry. I had hoped for a girlfriend two years ago on the last day of my business trip in Tokyo, before a big fantasy convention was about to take place. And then just a little while ago, I...hoped you could be able to choose what you did and didn't want your body to interact with, and you ended up being successful with it. I think it's my hope that dragged you here, and is keeping you here..." You pause, and then ask her, "Will...will you ever forgive me, Marie? Had I known this would have happened..."

Unsurprisingly, Marie looks down at you sternly, and then says the words you dreaded to hear, "No. No, I do not forgive you, Jake." But before you could look away in shame, surprisingly she smiles and adds, "I don't forgive you, Jake, because there is nothing to forgive. As much as I'd like to return to Heaven, at least I now know my purpose for being here. If I'm to be your girlfriend, I do not question His judgment on the matter."

An increasingly giant angel for a girlfriend...you feel like the luckiest man in the world. And feel as though you should thank the big guy 'upstairs' for such fortune. But first, you try to see the extent of what your hopes have on Marie. You hope for her to adopt a more...appropriate attire than just her robe, and the robe shrinks and reforms into a mid-thigh length white sleeveless dress that also allows her ample bust to be more visible, though tastefully so. Her golden sandals remain unchanged, and Marie seems quite pleased with her new look, her wings opening wide behind her before closing again. Next, you try to hope for her to be smaller, as she was a bit on the ridiculously tall side...with no luck. She remains 16'8" for now. Finally, you attempt to hope her in the opposite direction, and be like 25 foot even. At first, it seems to be working as Marie grows again...but she stops at 20 feet tall and not an inch more.

"It seems that I have some control over you, Marie, like the new outfit for example. But your height...isn't one of those things. I guess when and how much you grow is random, and not up to either of us to decide." you conclude. Marie nods in acknowledgement and says, "It would seem so. I do like the new dress, however. More modern from what I understand, yet is still conservative. Befitting the modern angel! Thank you!" You're glad that she likes it, as you feel it made her look all the more beautiful while still maintaining the aura of her innocence, as opposed to her being in a skimpy swimsuit, or just a bra and a pair of panties, or...well...nothing. Though a part of you believed that making her naked wasn't possible. And she'd object if it was. You decide to act on your feeling and go to church to offer gratitude for Marie while she (wisely) chose to remain at your place to pray. Perhaps for angels praying was like calling home to the big guy and letting Him know what's been happening?

A few hours later, your return home and find Marie sitting there patiently waiting for you...and a couple of would-be burglars hung in a tall tree with care. It was hard at first to tell, but eventually you ask your angel girlfriend, "You've grown again, haven't you?" Marie silently nods while you phone the police to come pick up the thieves, standing up to her full height of...
145221212111121.title: Hope - the reason for Marie's appearance?

choices: You decide to ask about Heaven if you can.
1452212121111212.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

50 feet tall. How...classic. Still, Marie's new clothing was keeping up with her perfectly fine, and she still seems to be okay with it, so you aren't worried about it too much. The police officer that came by to take the pair of would-be thieves...was considerably less than okay with it, however, despite her trying to calm him down.

"Alright, where are these criminals...at? Jesus Christ that woman is big!!!" he says, letting a curse slip out in shock. Marie, being blissfully unaware that it was a curse, responds happily while opening her wings, "I know him! He's a nice young man! Really, He couldn't ask for a better son!" This has the effect of making the normally dark skinned officer turn ghostly white. A giant, winged woman that spoke of knowing Jesus and the big guy upstairs on a personal level seems to have that effect on a person. Regardless, she pulls the burglars out of the tree she had left them in and hands them to the officer, who handles them far less gently than she had. Once the thieves were cuffed and placed in the police cruiser, the officer takes his leave, internally vowing not to reveal this to his friends and comrades back at the station...not that they would believe him if he told them.

This reminds you that you hadn't asked Marie her age. Obviously, she looked to be in her early to mid 20's, but angels were typically portrayed as ever beautiful...and she's no exception in your eyes. "If you don't mind me asking...just how old are you, Marie?" To your surprise, she seems to have no compunction over the question as she answers, "Older than Jesus, and not by a little bit. He is by far the youngest among us in terms of actual years, but as you might have guessed physical age has little meaning to us. None in Heaven appear any older than what humans would consider to be their prime, be they angel or departed human. You know the story of how Lucifer was cast out of Heaven to...where he currently resides? I was around even before that happened. Most angels were, and I believe I'm actually one of the younger ones."

This actually doesn't surprise you that Marie was this old. If He could create his desired number of angels from the very beginning, there would be little need to create more would there? Still, this doesn't diminish your feelings for her. She was still as sweet and pleasant and beautiful as ever. Perhaps, when the time came for you to take a walk with Death, you could reunite with Marie in her home? However, you don't feel it even nearly time to go yet. Still an entire lifetime ahead of you, with plenty to do and see along the way. While you're curious about what it was like up there, you also have a sense of wanting to find out for yourself.

After dinner, and the glass guys installing a new window when they could pull themselves away from gawking at the 50 foot tall angel that was your girlfriend, which was quickly remedied by telling them that you wouldn't pay for hours that they weren't actually working...
1452212121111212.title: 50 feet.

14522121211112122.content:
Original Author: Detective Barricade

Marie shudders, and quite fiercely. And given the gentle smile on her face not vanishing, you narrow the possibilities to just one thing: your angel girlfriend was about to get bigger. Possibly a lot bigger. A look in her eye suggests she'd like company while she grows, and since you know she would not cause further damage to your home than she had earlier, which had been repaired, you step out to do just that.

What you aren't expecting is for her to gently pick you up and hold you in her hand just as she starts growing. "I'm sorry, I should have asked if it was alright if I picked you up, but I didn't wish to risk ending your life so soon." Marie apologizes, and you shake your head saying, "It's okay, Marie. It wouldn't be very angelic of you to just ignore my presence if you would be putting me in possible danger, would it? I couldn't ask for a nicer girlfriend, even if she's clearing the 60 foot mark now." as she's doing just that and not stopping.

Marie grows past 70 feet in height, and then 80. What had to be already the biggest and best set of breasts either in Heaven or on Earth seem to grow just a bit more, and her dress keeps up with them effortlessly. As she grows to over 90 feet tall, with no sign yet of stopping, she spreads her beautiful wings in preparation to lift off the ground just in case. Just because she can choose not to interact with her immediate surroundings doesn't mean she wants to get careless, it seems, and you're glad for this.

Marie's growth takes her to and then past 100 feet, twice her height just a little while ago, and still doesn't seem to be letting up. Not that you mind at this point, because you have two magnificent views. The view of your house and the surrounding area as she continues to climb higher and higher in height, and the view of Marie's 120 foot tall and growing form. Both of which were almost breathtaking in their own ways.

"Everything seems so frail and fragile from here...almost like a snowflake in delicacy and beauty." Marie says as she grows to 140 feet and then 150 feet, triple her height almost 10 minutes ago or so. You're inclined to agree with her, and you say, "With your golden blonde locks, your blue eyes, heck, your everything and the scenery... I don't think I could find a prettier scene on a Christmas card. Unless it was snowing." you look up to the skies above and say to them, "Don't you be taking that as indication to start, up there." and Marie laughs her gentle laughter that could warm even the frostiest hearts. But has she stopped growing for now, or is Marie still growing?
14522121211112122.title: Another growth spurt...a big one.

145231111.title: In increasingly large spurts

choices: You offer her shelter in your house
She has her first growth spurt, and grows to nine inches tall!

1452311111.content:
Original Author: infinity421

You step off the patio and onto the grass, smiling slightly as you enjoy the feeling of the morning dew underfoot. You had sworn you'd heard something out here last night, but a quick search with a torch had failed to yield any results. Now that it was daytime, you should have a much easier time looking for any clues as to what made the noises you had heard.

A quick search of the flower bed turns up nothing, as does a look through your shed. You are about to head back inside when a glint in the corner of your eye catches you attention. Kneeling down, you investigate what reflected the sunlight.

It was a tiny wand, a small metal rod tipped with an equally small gold star. Picking it up, you begin to look it over, and wonder why it was in your garden.

"Hello, h-human?"

You wheel around, trying to find the source of the soft, quiet, voice, but see nothing.

"Human? Up h-here..."

Following the voice's instructions, you look upwards into the branches of your old apple tree, and what you see makes your jaw drop open.

Lying on one of the branches was a tiny figure, around six inches tall. But her size was not what really surprised you. Beautiful yet seemingly fragile wings sprouted from her shoulder blades, the shimmering blue appendages fluttering every so often as the fairy lay on her front.

The fairy seems to be trembling slightly - perhaps she was afraid of you?

"Don't worry, I'm not going to hurt you. What's your name?"

The fairy's trembling ceases after a couple of seconds, and a smile graces her tiny face. "My name is Juniper, human... Is that my wand you are holding?"

Easily able to reach the branch where Juniper is lying, you place the wand next to her and she eagerly grabs it. However, you can't help but notice that she seems rather pale, and a small shudder runs up her form.

What happens next?

Out of concern, you ask, "Are you alright, Juniper? You seem awfully pale...and you're shivering. Would you like to come inside?" The fairy looks you in the eye from her vantage point and admits softly, "No...I don't feel well at all. I-it's alright though, I'll just return home and look after myself... I wouldn't wish to trouble you, human..."

Sighing, you reach up and pluck Juniper gently from the tree, being careful of her shimmering blue insect-like wings, which looked somewhat like a cross between a butterfly's wings and those of a dragonfly, and say as you went inside with her, "Ho boy...I know your type. Nice as can be, yet too reserved to accept an offer of kindness in return for fear of being a bother. So I'm sorry, Juniper, but for your own good I'm not taking no for an answer." Juniper looks slightly sad that her choice was out of her hands, but doesn't complain.

Inside the warmth and dryness of your home, you set Juniper down in a seat close to the fireplace and turned it on so she could be comfortable...even though you know nothing about fairies outside of stories and even then the information in those tales varied wildly. And now that she wasn't lying on her front, you're able to get a better view of your guest. Her long, pink hair with several colorful highlights that stretched down her back was very pretty and you assume the base color was her natural hair color. The highlights were probably added in magically. She's quite slender...and is as curvacious as any model could ever hope to be naturally. Her breasts in particular could easily fill an E-cup at human size, if not F-cup. As a twenty-three year old woman yourself, you find yourself almost a little jealous of her. You realize that you never properly introduced yourself to her and work quickly to correct this. "I'm Anna, by the way. Are you comfortable by the fireplace? It runs on natural gas, by the way, so if it's too warm I can turn it down."

Juniper smiles warmly and a look of curiosity crosses her face as she says, "Pleased to meet you, Anna. We fairies don't tend to show ourselves around humans very often. Out of respect, mostly. But what is this 'natural gas' you speak of? How does it make fire appear and stay contained in the black metal box?" you explain to the fairy natural gas and how the fireplace works. Her look of wonder suggests fairies have little knowledge in general of human inventions. You suspect, however, that more than a few may be a bit too familiar with ones such as bulldozers.

However, your train of thought is promptly derailed when Juniper shudders and then begins to...grow? Yes, you could see her getting bigger little by little. And yet her silken dress, equally as colorful as her hair, easily keeps up with her as she continues to grow. Once she hit one foot one inch, she stops growing...for now anyway. Amazed at what just happened, you question Juniper and her enthusiastic smile with, "Well I see your shivering isn't because you're cold or sick...unless suddenly growing over twice your size is a symptom of some ailment to your kind. Would you care to explain?"

The fairy's face turns bright red, as her paleness had went away just after she finished growing, and says, "Well...no, growth isn't a symptom of a fairy ailment. In fact, our kind is so in tune with nature that we rarely ever get sick, and we're blessed with immortality...provided something doesn't kill us. A sharp object through one's heart is still fatal, nature's blessing or no. I...I often come to your garden to think at night when I can't sleep. I know it's trespassing. I'm sorry!"

You're surprised by this, but then you remember seeing the slightest flicker of something every now and again at night in your garden though it was gone before you could think to question what it was. Now you know that it was Juniper fluttering around. You...actually find yourself at peace with this, since she clearly didn't harm any of your flowers. You say, "Not a problem, Juniper. I don't mind, and you haven't harmed any of my flowers yet...but what does this have to do with your growth?"

Juniper smiles, happy that she was forgiven for the trespassing, and continues, "Well last night, I was trying out a spell I had just learned. Unfortunately...it backfired on me. And...well...I also kind of fumbled the spell as well. I could tell by the awfully large flash and the uneasy feeling that accompanied it. It normally only makes the target grow just a little bit, and only once per cast. If I were to cast it on you, for example, you'd only grow a few inches, maybe six at most. You'd hardly notice the difference. But I messed up and accidentally combined it with a continuing spell..."

"So that means..." you say, and Juniper nods in confirmation, "I'm going to grow again and again. I can't say how regular they'll be, but...each one is going to be bigger than the last. In two spurts, I'll be easily much taller than you and barely able to stand in here I'm sure. It might even be just one for all I know. It's okay, though! I've always wanted to be taller! And as long as I have my wand, I can try to fix anything I break! I guess this means my kind will no longer be much of a secret to yours, though..." Well at least she was kind enough to think of the problems her ever increasing size would later cause...but what's going to happen now?

You lay on your bed, eyes staring at the ceiling as you listen to the torrential rainfall. (Bleep)ing British weather.

As you listen, the rainfall seems to lessen slightly. Perhaps it was finally stopping? You roll out of bed and onto the floor, pushing yourself upwards into a standing position. Flinging the curtains open, you see that the rain is indeed beginning to let up. Sighing happily, you turn back towards your room. Perhaps you'd finally be able to get some sleep, now.

Suddenly, a flash of lightning illuminates your room. In the mirror, directly opposite where you currently stood, you saw...

Something.

Paper-white skin, razor sharp teeth, and eyes that were little but black voids. You only saw the face for duration of an eyeblink, but you were paralysed by fear. Surely you hadn't just seen that?

Another flash if lightning.

The face in the mirror was more recognisably human, now. But something about it was still off. The face was still too pale, its teeth still disturbingly sharp, and although the eyes had formed into those of humans, the pupils were jet black.

Then, the face was gone again. Trying to keep your breathing under control, you get back into bed, but you can't keep your eyes from wandering back over to the mirror.

Another flash of lightning illuminates your room

The face is now that of a human, and recognisably human. For the brief moment that you can see it, the face is smiling, her still-pale features no longer quite so monstrous.

Yet another flash of lightning.

The surface of the mirror begins to ripple, and before you can react, a pale body is launched out of the mirror and into your room. Oh no, no no no...

The mirror-woman, who lay in a heap at the foot of your bed, untangled herself and rose up to her full height, towering over your prone form. She doesn't seem malicious, however, and instead seems to be... happy?

"Owner, I'm finally out of the mirror! Now we can watch each other in the mornings and evenings, and while you brush your teeth and-"

What? Owner? Watch each other?

You raise a hand to attract the pale mirror-woman's attention, who looks down at you with eyes that are constantly changing colour, and you say...

145232222221.content:
Original Author: MysticMeistro

A sharp smack resonated across the kitchen, when the sugar cube Vip had dropped from the bowl fell onto the kitchen table. As she dropped down herself, she froze in a clenched stance and listened intensely for hear worst fear. Footsteps could suddenly be heard outside the door across the kitchen, and Vip despaired. “Spidershit” she yelled out, as she grabbed onto the cube beside her. With a great grunt, she lifted it onto her shoulder and scooped her head to the side to create the needed room. The weight of the cube overwhelmed her, and she felt her legs sink below her, yet she persisted and found the strength to carry on, knowing that the sugar was needed down below. She then dashed across the kitchen table to the cupboard some 3 meters ahead of her. As she reached it, a creaking sound could be heard from the door where the footsteps ended. She then quickly dropped the sugar cube down, and shoved it into the hole. Vip herself just about made it in and covered the hole up with the loose concrete that served as disguise for their entrance. The hole was scarce 2 inches in height, and only just wide enough to fit in the cube. Vip herself had to bend to less than a third her stature just to get in, being only 3.8 inches tall. Yet the small hole server her kin well, having allowed them to smuggle many delicacies from the human kitchen over the years. When the hole was tightly sealed, Vip rejoiced and sighed in delight.

With that out of the way Vip got back to work. Building strength to carry the cube once more, Vip lifted it up high on her chest to gain support from her back, and sent it down gliding down the slideway few steps before her. After a few stretches she herself took the trip down below, following behind the cube.
Every time Vip went either up, through the tunnels, or down with the slide she rejoiced over the life she and her kin had made themselves down here. 30 years ago the house outside had been abandoned. During those days Vip and her family had lived in the rooms around the house and has used the garden to gather whatever sustainance they and the rest of the kin had needed. Vip, who was only 60 years, still only a kid for a pixie, had recalled these memories as her happy toddler-years. Then one summer, “the inheritants” as her brother called them had arrived and taken over the house. Over the course of just 2 weeks, all rooms which formerly had been empty and desolate save for a few tables and chairs, and a dresser here and there, was filled with all the colossal, trivial things humans needed in their lives. Sofas, and TVs and toys for the small ones. And that horrible dog with its curious nose, and its sharp teeth, and the constant barking. Vip hated that. Not only had the family filled the house out with lifeless things. They were wealthy and the house had needed cleaning which the lady of the family had refused to do herself. So the husband had hired an elderly woman and her two granddaughters to live as retainers given that they did their cleaning. While the daughters were nice, their grandmother was a curious and staunch lady, who had spotted one from The Kin some years back and had made a silent crusade in hunting down the pests. Vip could barely count how many times she had nearly caught one of her kin.

With the humans having taken the house, Vip and her family had spent some time in the shack in the garden, the last place the humans took over. After some debating The Kin had decided to move, much to Vip´s sadness. But with what seemed a miracle, Vip´s brother had come back few days before the exodus, and told them of the amazement. Beneath the great house, he had found a colossal series of tunnels that led beneath the human homestead and throughout the walls of their house. The Kin changed their course of action, and after some years and shunning the spiders and whatnot away, they managed to create this system of caverns-complete with ladders and slides, which now served as their home. And to their luck, the tunnels allowed them to spy and pillage the humans from time to time. Mostly the kitchen, where the pixies stole spices and other from in shifts. Today was Vip´s day and she had been successful, if not lucky with the sugar.

At the end of the slide, Vip placed the sugar cube on the shelf with the other stolen groceries. She then ran out the room, and into the great cavern, where she knew her brother would be waiting in his shelf-room. Planks and web served as bridges and ladders, from which Vip navigated her way up the hall. On her way she met some of her Kin, who all greeted her. Some even jested her for being late with finishing her daily assignment, to which she grimaced back. When she finally her brothers room, she entered silently. She found him walking across an open book he and some of the Kin had pilfered from above some weeks ago. The book was far too large for him to simply read, so he made due with strutting across the words reading them in the process. Vip was not the great reader, and had never really cared much for books either, but her brother had always taken great interest in the knowledge of the outside world they provided.

“I got the cube back brother” Vip said, interrupting her brothers reading as politly as she could. Her brother lifted his dark-haired head as he snapped out of the reading world, and looked upon her with a gentle smile.
“Nicely done, Vip” he said with delight, as he pointed a thumbs-up towards her. Vip smiled back. “And did you bring the pepper corns straight to the kitchen?” Her brother remarked, still smiling. Here Vip´s smile disappeared. She had forgotten the damn pepper. As she stood in silence and sank, her brothers smile waned as well. He lifted his fingers to his eyes and rubbed them as he nodded in disapproval.
“You forgot the pepper, didn’t you” he said in a annoyed tone. Vip remained silent. Her brother gave her a taunting look, as he awaited an answer in vain. Vip backed a few steps away and looked down onto her naked feet.
“This is the third time you forget something on kitchen duty Vip.” Her brother said.
“Sugar is delicious and all, but we need the REAL spices for food. Not just the sweets you want” he continued. He was right. Vip did have a sweet tooth, and the thought of sugar did overshadow the want for a real meal from time to time. Vip looked up and tried to defend herself.
“But there was a human, and the sugar fell and my legs and….” She mumbled, tripping over each sentence. Her brothers expression did not change one bit.
“Well you´re just gonna have to go back there. You´re not done with your chores yet” he said all parent-ish. Vip was at a loss for words over her fogetfullness, and rather than take the fight up with her brother (him both being one of the Kin´s leaders and her guardian) simply walked out of the room. For this her brother did feel slightly bad for his tone towards her.
“Relax” he said as she left.
“It’s just a bit of pepper” he yelled to her. Vip turned and looked back. She nodded in agreement and left the room with a “sorry” being her final words to her brother…..

What happens on the way to the kitchen

As you go about your day you realize life can be pretty dull at times. And today's routine just so happens to be the dullest. Its like all your tasks you've been given both at home and at school have been just done so fast no time went by. You know it sucks especially when conversations around you revolve around how slow the day is dragging on. Well finally after a few more hours you oddly get called to the principle's office of your school. You probably bet its someone framing you again for having drugs on campus or for stealing books or something totally out of your nature. What you didn't expect was to be greeted by someone you were sure you had forgotten about due to time. Your mother. Oddly however she seems way younger, when you yourself know she's close to her 30's/40's range, she looks almost as if she just gave birth to you but without the weight.

"Hello my dear son." She says with a smile. "Its been awhile, but lets go home. We have a lot to talk about, and im eager to show you something's your father may have kept you from." Apparently the school was ok with it so why question anything when your mother who left 4 years prior to your middle school educational life began.

As the two of you spoke and went home, not to your original home, no to your mothers home. That was a breath of fresh air itself. You never truely realized how far away your mother was from you, considering she had to move houses and switch up things considering she told you her work was that of time travel scientific things. At least thats what you assume because she never explained it fully due to the secrecy she needs to maintain.

As you both enter the house its very clean and organized even for your mother's standards because when she obsesses over work there's no telling where you'll find her. Either way she takes you into her work basement where she easily has somehow made a fully functional time machine and not just to reverse her age as you can see.

She messes with the controls and such and soon a portal is opened, and she motions to you. "Sorry sweetie, but I will explain in short." She takes a moment to gather herself. "I been working on this time travel machine for a long while but I also noticed something else. I can send you to a different world with this, and so I need a test subject to try it out. I'm sending you because you can help someone I know from a different world. I just got back yesterday and well thats how you see me, as if i never aged. That place unaged me and not to where I couldn't do anything, but it kept my mind intact. I put a piece of my mind in the machine as a way to help you. You'll understand sooner or later why I'm picking you." With that in your head you can't help but think she's using you, but her words speak of a crisis elsewhere, that you and your mother could solve. Hence why she picked you.

After a brief moment of selection, she activates the portal and sends you off into the world unknown.

You land in a new world where everything is.... shiny as all hell. First observation is easily made that everything is freaking shiny.

Well despite that you look about and notice 4 things different, there are humans, robots, robotic anthro like things, and anthro's themselves. So at most you can say this world has no species discrimination... yet.

As you walk about your surroundings you start noticing the world around you looks cool, shiny, robotic, convenient, and much much more. After doing what most people would do, you look for a bar, and after about 2 to 3 hours of wandering around aimlessly with vague hints you find a bar.

As you stumble into this bar you hear a conversation being said a little to loud. "I tell ya's that lab in the outskirts is haunted. Its haunted by ghost's and demons i say!" You question the sobriety of the person speaking but decide to ask where it's location is. After getting 20 some hints on how to find it, and another 2 hours to follow all the mixed up hints you find this abandoned lab. You can tell via the broken down door, and no lights and basically every other sign of it being abandoned. And then acting like a bravery filled knight, walk into this lab and begin searching which becomes easier when motion lights activate yet with one being blue, another being red, and a 3rd one being green the question comes to mind on what was going through the owner's mind with the lights.

As you delve deeper into this abandoned lab you find a actually active diagnostic tube with... a humanoid girl inside? As you look around a video seems to be playing on loop showing that she is actually a robot girl advanced enough that she thinks, feels emotions, and all that like a human but is definitely a robot, and not to mention there's a bit of data clumps as you look through the files inside specifically meant for the robot girl. So as a curious being you being your search amongst the files for an activation code of some sort. With luck and your newly found scientific prowess from your mother's intellect being partially fused into you, you discover the codes to activate the tube to turn the girl on and all that.

The process goes fast and the girl emerges out of the tube and to your surprise she had a very unusual type of body with a size E breasts and a big and curvy butt to match it, and not to mention the tube looked a little to small to contain her, nevertheless you released her and helped her up, and you first begin to show her all the data clusters inside the computer meant for her.

With the clusters now scanned she looks to you and smiles and suddenly speaks... very fluently as well. "Thank you for showing me these things and for awakening me." "Your welcome" you reply. "The data blocks you've helped me scanned gave me all the knowledge i needed~ including how your not from this world, and only recently arrived." "woah... how the hell you know?" "The last cluster of data gave me knowledge of a brilliant scientist whom sent her son to this place. And mentioned that your reaction was going to roughly be of that in which you've expressed."

"Hmmm... so that means my mom lied and just sent me to the future?" "Pretty much but not in the future of your world. This is a different dimension all together. Also the cluster mentioned about getting out of the house within a few minutes but I don't get why. Do you know?" It was now at this time she looked back to you to notice. She was growing and at an alarming rate. "Oh.... well then." She quickly bent down to pick you up and then bolted through the wall of the lab and out into the open. Thankfully it wasn't to damaging because the building was still standing. "Okay... so if I was fashioned to be 6ft tall when I was awoken... and soon to start growing merely minutes after awakening... I've grown and will grow 3ft a minute til im close to 300ft tall. Unless my estimation is off."

She looked down at you in her ever growing palm and smiles not noticing she was nude, but as a robot whom had no nipples or vag, she didn't mind being 'nude' but when she stopped at the 300ft mark, her body just formed clothes to cover herself, and she kept holding you close, so two things became clear.

Your mom has been eavesdropping on your Giantess fetish, She sent you to a place with a giant gentle growing robot, and lastly, you don't care that your possibly never going back.
1452322222221.title: Time travel is fun right? Right?

The last thing it mentioned is that it takes a few more minutes each growth spurt before the next occurs. So it wont be for about another 10 minutes til my next spurt if I calculated correctly."

"Alright well... what kind of powers or cool gadgets does your body hold? I mean outside forming clothes out of like thin air."
"Well there's my arms which have multiple ways to attack things outside of just being hands. I can morph them into multiple forms such as a gun, some claws, a grapple beam thing, a flamethrower, and a piston puncher. But outside of that, my body can adapt to just about anything given enough prep time to adjust to a new climate or something of the sort. I also have a compartment for storage which can keep people safe from harsh environment explorations."
"Man they jam packed you with almost everything!"
"That seems to be the case ^^;"
"Hmm... well im kinda curious but lets go find a safe place to try it. People say meditation can work wonders but us sitting in a city near abandoned... or thought to be abandoned buildings isn't the best place for meditation. Can you scan for a more... quieter place? Like a forest or something?"

Natalie nods and closes her eyes as she begins to start a scan. Almost by instinct she heads off towards the mountains outside the city they're in, and as she walks the next growth spurt kicks in taking her from 700ft tall to close to 2,400ft tall. 153.content:
Original Author: The Black Mamba

You are Daisy, an 8-year old girl with big dreams. You were always picked on by bullies, being weak and emotional, and get pushed down almost every day. Your only dream was to become an adult, living in the real world of freedom and equality, where no one could do wrong.

Walking home from school with another black eye, you decided to stay with your friend Jane to play dolls. You decided to do this without having your mother see you, as she would drag you in if she does. You take a detour through the forest, the first time you've done so.

In minutes you got lost. The paths grew darker and darker. You were about to cry in fear. You wished you had stayed with your mother, who always protected you from dangers such as this. Now there was little hope of seeing her again.

You hear a voice. "Daisy, help me."

You stopped weeping and looked around. The voice didn't seem to come from anywhere.

"Daisy, over here."

You walked through the forest a little longer, until you came to a tree that seemed to have a blueish glow. You were curious; no tree could naturally glow like that. You inched forward and put your hand on it. It was warm, but it was still a tree.

Suddenly its glow stopped, and darkness overcame you again. You knelt down in tears.

The voice spoke again. "Daisy, thank you."

You turned around and saw a woman, who seemed to be glowing like the tree was, only brighter. She was beautiful, more than twice as gorgeous as the supermodels you see on TV.

"Thank you for releasing me from my prison," the glowing woman said. "I am Bonum, an angel for good. The forces of darkness held me here on the edge of the forest, where no one would find me for a while. It has been centuries."

You were puzzled. "I thought good always beats evil," you say.

"Ah, your undeveloped mind. In the real world, evil almost always wins, since I was in this jail. Although it seems like good does win there, it is ineffective. If only the world knows how to be kind and courteous to others..."

She trails off. "Never mind, to repay your kind act, I will grant you one wish, and this can be anything at all."

This is your lucky day. You can finally become an adult and abandon your troubles.

"I wish I grew up!"

Suddenly you remembered what Bonum said. "In the real world, evil almost always wins." Your life in adulthood could be worse than your life in childhood.

You look at Bonum, and she frowned. "This wish has multiple meanings. You may not like it, but I will grant to you both of them. Enjoy the ride."

She waved her hand, and everything went black.

...

You wake up in a grassy field, everything around you feeling warm. The grass was trimmed short, making it a relaxing place to take a nap. That's probably what you did; you were still tired.

You remembered Bonum, and what she did. It must have been a dream, you thought. You must have fallen asleep and given that vision. You stand up... and your head enters the clouds above. But that was impossible, the clouds are miles in the air and you're only 3' 10".

Suddenly a horrible thought came to you. The grass isn't short... I grew.

That's the best you could describe it, since you were only 8-years old. You bent down so you could see the world better. What you say instead was yourself. You were in new clothes. Your skin seemed luminous and shiny. You felt powerful, and more feminine.

You looked around. Mostly in your field of vision was grass, but there was a city to your right, and a farm straight ahead. You could show yourself to the public, or go to the farm in hopes of grabbing food, since it won't be easy when you're as tall as the neighboring city is wide. Then again, the city could provide some to. Where will you go?
